title: AI and the Future of Work – Study
description: Collaborated with researchers to build data collection app for pilot study measuring AI-driven productivity gains across workplace tasks. Study with 500 participants found 25% higher quality and 61% faster completion with AI assistance.

title: AI Advice-Giving – Study
description: Expanded our experiment apps platform for supporting longitudinal controlled study examining how people follow AI advice. Found 75% of participants followed GPT-4o advice on personal matters, though with no sustained well-being improvements.

title: AI and Political Knowledge – Study
description: Worked closely with researchers to build web app and infrastructure for the data collection for empirical study with 2,858 participants examining AI chatbot usage for political information. Demonstrated AI increases political knowledge as effectively as internet search.

title: Public Design Conference 2025
description: Co-organised the inaugural global public design conference bringing together government designers worldwide. Part of World Design Congress, in collaboration with Royal College of Art and Greater London Authority.

title: AISI HAI @ Services Week 2025
description: Presented AISI's research tools at Services Week 2025, the UK government's annual event bringing together public sector professionals to share knowledge on service design and digital innovation.

title: AISI HAI @ CHI 2025 STAIG Panel
description: Panel speaker at the CHI 2025 workshop on Sociotechnical AI Governance: Opportunities and Challenges for HCI. Hybrid event held in Yokohama, Japan discussing AI governance from HCI perspectives.

title: AISI EurIPS 2025 Social
description: Organised the UK AI Security Institute's social event during EurIPS 2025 in Copenhagen, bringing together roughly 50 attendees from the AI safety research community to discuss frontier AI risks and technical solutions.

title: Making AI More Understandable
description: BBC R&D project researching Explainable AI to make AI decision-making transparent and interpretable. Prototyped ML-powered proofs-of-concept including generative ML art and interactive visualizations.

title: BBC Together
description: A trial of a social watching and listening experience from BBC R&D. Multi-user iPlayer viewer enabling synchronized viewing experiences. Ran on BBC Taster for 1.5 years.

title: BBC Tech Meetup
description: Co-organised the BBC Tech Meetup, facilitating knowledge sharing on latest technologies and development practices.

title: Trent Basin Community Information Model
description: Experience design for data visualisation project of building energy data for Trent Basin re-development project while at IES Ltd.

title: EU HORIZON – ENTRUST
description: EU H2020 R&D project during my time at IES Ltd on improving energy efficiency for the built environment and researching social factors in energy citizenship. Led requirements analysis and UX development. Research findings published on energy citizenship and community engagement in sustainable energy transitions.

title: Lab² – A collaborative cross-reality game for virtual team building
description: Master's Thesis project. A collaborative cross-reality game for virtual team building. Award 'Best Research Poster' at iLRN Conference

title: Master's Portfolio
description: Portfolio showcasing three major projects from my M.Sc. in Visualisation: Serious Games Development at Glasgow School of Art. Features Lab² (cross-reality collaboration), GoMA (RT3D heritage visualisation) and Spartathlon (Serious Game using Fitbit).

title: TEDxStuttgart
description: Co-organised regular TEDx event series showcasing innovative ideas in technology, education and design from and for the city of Stuttgart and the land Baden-Württemberg. Events: Act. Change. Now., Post-X, Collaborate For Humanity, Re:Think – Re:Invent – Re:Create.
